weather_report:
The morning in Downtown San Francisco begins with a gentle embrace of clouds looming overhead, foretelling a chance of rain as the day unfolds. The air holds a mild chill, hinting at the cooler temperatures to come. Visually, the city remains somewhat obscured by a light veil, characteristic of this season, where the fog often dances lightly along the edges of the skyline. While visibility may be limited to a soft focus, the familiar contours of the Golden Gate stand steadfast, though perhaps shrouded in mystery. 

As the day progresses, anticipate a persistent cloud cover, with temperatures nudging gently towards the low 60s. With the easterly breezes whispering softly, the possibility of scattered raindrops lingers throughout the afternoon, hinting at a moist respite that may awaken the streets. For those venturing out, cozy layers will be your ally—think layered sweaters or light jackets, along with a waterproof outer shell, just in case. It’s a perfect time for introspective walks along hidden alleyways or perhaps enjoying the ambiance of a snug café where the rich aroma of coffee swirls in tune with the rainy rhythms outside.
